verses.verse: Then Job <S%H347><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%>,
I know <S%H3045><s%> that thou canst do <S%H3201><s%> all things <S%H4209><s%>, And that no purpose of thine can be restrained <S%H1219><s%>.

Who is this that hideth <S%H5956><s%> counsel <S%H6098><s%> without knowledge <S%H1847><s%>? Therefore have I uttered <S%H5046><s%> that which I understood <S%H995><s%> not <S%H6381><s%>, Things too wonderful for me <S%H3045><s%>, which I knew not.
Hear <S%H8085><s%>, I beseech thee <S%H1696><s%>, and I will speak; I will demand <S%H7592><s%> of thee <S%H3045><s%>, and declare thou unto me.
I had heard <S%H8085><s%> of thee by the hearing <S%H8088><s%> of the ear <S%H241><s%>; But now mine eye <S%H5869><s%> seeth thee <S%H7200><s%>:
Wherefore I abhor <S%H3988><s%> myself <S%H5162><s%>, And repent in dust <S%H6083><s%> and ashes <S%H665><s%>.

And it was so <S%H310><s%>, that, after Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> had spoken <S%H1696><s%> these words <S%H1697><s%> unto Job <S%H347><s%>, Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Eliphaz <S%H464><s%> the Temanite <S%H8489><s%>, My wrath <S%H639><s%> is kindled <S%H2734><s%> against thee <S%H8147><s%>, and against thy two friends <S%H7453><s%>; for ye have not spoken <S%H1696><s%> of me the thing that is right <S%H3559><s%>, as my servant <S%H5650><s%> Job hath <S%H347><s%>.

Now therefore <S%H3947><s%>, take unto you seven <S%H7651><s%> bullocks <S%H6499><s%> and seven <S%H7651><s%> rams <S%H352><s%>, and go <S%H3212><s%> to my servant <S%H5650><s%> Job <S%H347><s%>, and offer up <S%H5927><s%> for yourselves a burnt-offering <S%H5930><s%>; and my servant <S%H5650><s%> Job <S%H347><s%> shall pray <S%H6419><s%> for you <S%H6440><s%>; for him will I accept <S%H5375><s%>, that I deal <S%H6213><s%> not with you after your folly <S%H5039><s%>; for ye have not spoken <S%H1696><s%> of me the thing that is right <S%H3559><s%>, as my servant <S%H5650><s%> Job hath <S%H347><s%>.

So Eliphaz <S%H464><s%> the Temanite <S%H8489><s%> and Bildad <S%H1085><s%> the Shuhite <S%H7747><s%> and Zophar <S%H6691><s%> the Naamathite <S%H5284><s%> went <S%H3212><s%>, and did <S%H6213><s%> according as Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> commanded <S%H1696><s%> them <S%H3068><s%>: and Jehovah accepted <S%H5375><s%> Job <S%H6440><s%>.

And Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> turned <S%H7725><s%> the captivity <S%H7622><s%> of Job <S%H347><s%>, when he prayed <S%H6419><s%> for his friends <S%H7453><s%>: and Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> gave <S%H3254><s%> Job <S%H347><s%> twice as much as he had before <S%H4932><s%>.

Then came <S%H935><s%> there unto him all his brethren <S%H251><s%>, and all his sisters <S%H269><s%>, and all they that had been of his acquaintance <S%H3045><s%> before <S%H6440><s%>, and did eat <S%H398><s%> bread <S%H3899><s%> with him in his house <S%H1004><s%>: and they bemoaned <S%H5110><s%> him <S%H5162><s%>, and comforted him concerning all the evil <S%H7451><s%> that Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> had brought <S%H935><s%> upon him <S%H376><s%>: every man also gave <S%H5414><s%> him a <S%H259><s%> piece of money <S%H7192><s%>, and every one <S%H376><s%> a <S%H259><s%> ring of gold <S%H2091><s%>.

So Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> blessed <S%H1288><s%> the latter end <S%H319><s%> of Job <S%H347><s%> more than his beginning <S%H7225><s%>: And he had fourteen <S%H702><s%> thousand <S%H505><s%> sheep <S%H6629><s%>, and six <S%H8337><s%> thousand <S%H505><s%> camels <S%H1581><s%>, and a thousand <S%H505><s%> yoke <S%H6776><s%> of oxen <S%H1241><s%>, and a thousand <S%H505><s%> she-asses <S%H860><s%>.
He had also seven <S%H7658><s%> sons <S%H1121><s%> and three <S%H7969><s%> daughters <S%H1323><s%>.

And he called <S%H7121><s%> the name <S%H8034><s%> of the first <S%H259><s%>, Jemimah <S%H3224><s%>: and the name <S%H8034><s%> of the second <S%H8145><s%>, Keziah <S%H7103><s%>; and the name <S%H8034><s%> of the third <S%H7992><s%>, Keren-happuch <S%H7163><s%>.

And in all the land <S%H776><s%> were no women <S%H802><s%> found <S%H4672><s%> so fair <S%H3303><s%> as the daughters <S%H1323><s%> of Job <S%H347><s%>: and their father <S%H1><s%> gave <S%H5414><s%> them inheritance <S%H5159><s%> among <S%H8432><s%> their brethren <S%H251><s%>.

And after <S%H310><s%> this Job <S%H347><s%> lived <S%H2421><s%> a hundred <S%H3967><s%> and forty <S%H705><s%> years <S%H8141><s%>, and saw <S%H7200><s%> his sons <S%H1121><s%>, and his sons <S%H1121><s%>' sons <S%H1121><s%>, even four <S%H702><s%> generations <S%H1755><s%>.
So Job <S%H347><s%> died <S%H4191><s%>, being old <S%H2205><s%> and full <S%H7649><s%> of days <S%H3117><s%>.
